column5: Do I have to put two paddles in a boat or you just need one paddle.  Thanks!
Not sure,but if you have two,easier to keep the boat straight. I've always seen two.Not sure what the law requires.
It used to be that 1 paddle was legal. Not anymore, you need two. Cheers
IN my boat it depends what your doing  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XKDnviT0FIQ
Only one is required OR an anchor.
...With at least 50 feet of rope/chain I believe.
It says either, both not required, but, it doesn't hurt, kinda hard to anchor a boat with a paddle or row ith an anchor...
I have a pair of oars and one paddle. I my motor conks, nobody rides for free! LOL
Mine was meant to add to Roy's post, not stand on its own.
Well I'm sure Roy meant with the rope, another kinda hard to hold the anchor and boat when your more than an arms length apart..
It's also hard to anchor a boot in even 40 feet of water with only 5o feet of rope. I always figured it was so that as a unpowered boat got close to shore the anchor would finally "catch".

I totally stand corrected. I thought for sure that had changed. I want two anyway, for dual paddling in case of trouble. As if a single paddle could do very much saving a heavy boat in a strong wind anyway. Cheers
This post makes me want to have twin outboards cause I know I ain't paddling.
Very good !  You have way too much time on your hands!  LOL!
Hey, it's sunday night, the icecream buckets empty, no chips, the wife won't hold still,....
